column2: COVID-19 negative certification required for entering the country Kiribati will deny entry to any travellers who have been in or transited countries with confirmed local transmission within 14 days immediately prior to entering Kiribati. A list of countries covered by these restrictions is available from the Kiribati Ministry of Health and Medical Services
column3: Quarantine requirement outside territory. Kiribati will deny entry to any travellers who have been in or transited countries with confirmed local transmission within 14 days immediately prior to entering Kiribati. Latest News: Authorities in Kiribati and Samoa impose lockdowns because of COVID-19 (ABC, 22.02.2022).

International Restrictions:
*Entry rules in response to coronavirus (COVID-19): Kiribati re-opened its borders on 1 August 2022. For the latest information on COVID-19 protocols for entry to Kiribati, see announcements on the Governmentâ€™s social media posts on Facebook

Internal Restrictions:
Travel in Kiribati: f you test positive for COVID-19, you may need to stay where you are until you test negative. You may also need to seek treatment there.
